com.github.fge.jsonschema.processing

Class ProcessorChain<IN extends MessageProvider,OUT extends MessageProvider>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.jsonschema.processing.ProcessorChain<IN,OUT>
  • Type Parameters:
    IN - the input type for that chain
    OUT - the output type for that chain
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Processor<IN,OUT>

    public final class ProcessorChain<IN extends MessageProvider,OUT extends MessageProvider>
extends Object
implements Processor<IN,OUT>
    A processor chain

    This class allows to build a chain out of different Processor instances. The result behaves like a processor itself, so it can be used in other chains as well.

    Sample usage:

         final Processor<X, Y> chain = ProcessorChain.startWith(p1)
         .chainWith(p2).chainWith(...);

     // input is of type X
     final Y ret = chain.process(report, X);

        public <NEWOUT extends MessageProvider> ProcessorChain<IN,NEWOUT> chainWith(Processor<OUT,NEWOUT> p2)
        Add an existing processor to that chain

        Note that this returns a new chain.

        Type Parameters:
        NEWOUT - the return type for that new processor
        Parameters:
        p2 - the processor to add
        Returns:
        a new chain consisting of the previous chain with the new processor appended
